title: Riot wants to make it easier to win stalled out games
body:
According to them its too hard to win games where you have a lead and will inevitably win. You know what would fucking solve this problem better than buffing objectives and nerfing turrets?

MAKING IT SO EVERY FUCKING GAME WASNT DECIDED BY 10 MINUTES AND PEOPLE ACTUALLY HAD A FUCKING CHANCE TO COME BACK.

Not like I'm not wrong; Riot made a fast-paced meta that rewards early initiative and securing early leads.  Who can do this the easiest?  Mostly assassins, sometimes divers.  The result?  A 2-3 level lead on them, deadly roams, and a feeling of dread as no one can either a.) pop off fast enough or b.) do anything to actually stop them.
Calling people "mindless one tricks" and "braindead no skill assassins" is still stereotyping.

A game which rewards early aggression and good play making to gain an advantage is very healthy. The issue is when assains begin stepping on the toes of other roles, in their capacity to extend this lead to others.

No one like to be told they suck, and even few like to have it proven to them, but sometimes you really are just the inferior player, and there is nothing wrong with having that demonstrated to you by being bent over by a 10/0 Zed.

You had 3 chances, now if you want to undo everything the other player worked so hard for, you better be damn ready to beat them, kill them, and use their death window to level the playing feild

How do I do that?  Buy stopwatch and hope they're stupid enough to dive me?  Get jungler to help, assuming they don't judge your lane "unsalvagable"?  Gank another lane to farm up and hope the assassin doesn't follow you or gank a separate lane using their lead?  
I mean, "even footing" may account for a level, maybe two, but how about items?  Gold?  

I mean, it is not like they can't roam from their lane to a HVT like bot lane.  It's not physically possible and illogical, is it?

Assassins are (or at least should be) balanced around the idea of small victories. Whether its forcing you out of lane, getting off an invade, making a roam, or just killing you they gain a small victory each time. They should start from the disadvantage, then after the first victory, be even with you. You must either knock them back down by winning some victory over them, or, they will end up with the advantage in all subsequent fights. Then you're on the ropes. If you lose again, you had 3 chances, and you flubbed all of them. The other player earned the victory. So if you want to tear them back down, you're gonna have to pull off something just as impressive as them beating you all those times in a row, even when they themselves were on the back foot, you have to win from behind once, which levels out the playing feild a little bit. Its now easier, and the hole is not as deep. Then you have to do it again. And remmber the assassin depend on constantly extending their lead. If you manage to halt their lead, for even 3 attempts, it doesnt matter that you're behind because you've put them on a downward spiral. Thats what makes it balacned

And that's what is so unfun about assassins (and snowballing in general); they're unfun to play as because one loss=deadweight.  They're unfun to play because one loss=i'ma going to die again. They can roam bot and get two more kills, invade the jungler, quash the top lane, just to name a few options.  You can't just hope they be dummies and die, you're right, but most aren't stupid enough to stay in one place; they got a small victory, now they press their advantage.  What's the point of pinning someone down if they either can roam away or just ambush you later?

I see nothing wrong with people who revel in snowballing. If you allow someone to snowball early then that's your own fault for sucking at the game.

It's much better than the game becoming "Lol, remember when you dumpstered me in the 1v1 early game? Well I guess i'm gonna outscale you now, LOL OUT PLAYED"

But these constant posts that only complain and whine, they don't do anything to solve the issue, so they're just constant repeats of the same complaints.

I completely, utterly, 100% agree with OP's all caps statement.  That said, the post doesn't make sense.  IF both teams have a chance in every game and IF the "losing" team has a chance to come back, then how the HELL does that solve the "problem" of games being too hard to close out when you're ahead?!?  IMO, not being able to close out means you're not good enough or you're not good at using your lead.  That is not a PROBLEM that needs to be solved, that's players being bad.

>IMO, not being able to close out means you're not good enough or you're not good at using your lead.  That is not a PROBLEM that needs to be solved, that's players being bad.

I've been playing for three-and-half years, and this was the attitude players and Riot had for pretty much my first year of playing and it was great. When Riot shifted to making it easier for games to finish when ahead (way back in patch 5.23 with the minions being stronger for the team that's ahead to make it easier to push towers when ahead and harder to manipulate your minion wave to push out and buy time when behind), things started slowly going downhill a bit as far as game quality for me, and that just got worse and worse as more changes were made to make closing out games easier because it makes snowballing so much more important.

It's particularly sad because they said sometime around pre-season 6 (I think, it may have been a little later) that they didn't want stalling to be such a strong tactic but that they didn't want to eliminate it as a possible option. It's felt more and more as time has gone on that playing safe isn't supposed to be an option even when at a small deficit, though, with the very notable exception of earlier this year when late-game wave clear made defending sieges far too easy.

First they'll need to fix the problem with champs whose only win condition (or macro counterplay, in the reverse) is crushing early or crushing late. 

In mid right now, the only counterplay to assassins is to rush Zhonya's and try to not die very many times before you hit 2900g + mana item. Then you're mostly useless because you have 75 AP and none of the items in your core build. The only real chance you have is by stalling out.

It's exciting to play an immobile scaling marksman and slowly grow into a big boy who gets to bully the bullies.  What your suggesting is just homogenization of champ pool which would be less strategic and less exciting tbh.

The best games I've had in League are the longer games with a lot of back-and-forth where it wasn't clear who was going to win. There were so many moments of positive intensity back then even if I was losing because I knew I had a chance if I played it right and it felt great to go through those rises and dips. The game feeling like there's an inevitable outcome early now just creates negative intensity for whoever starts losing and getting the snowball going on my side feels boring very quickly. I really miss the days when either team could win even if one side was a bit ahead.

Best game I had this season. Was when my team snowballed like crazy, but the other team stayed on point had insane vision, and successful ly stalled out the game till we fell off, and even tho we got their Nexus to 75 health we lost.

Games arent decided by 10 minutes. Unless a late game teamcomp beat your earlygame teamcomp early game you can still win. Hell, the longer the game goes on the higher the chances youll actually win because gold leads mean less and less the closer to 5 items you get.
